root.name: NFL Street
root.description: NFL Street was developed by EA Tiburon in an attempt to create a football counterpart to their successful NBA Street games. EA had already established Madden NFL and the Head Coach series, and Sega had established the 2K series of football. The NFL Blitz series was embarking on a slow decline, the most recent release at the time being NFL Blitz: Pro. With plans set in place to buy the exclusive rights to use the NFL and its teams, EA saw an opportunity to own the best arcade football franchise, which would become the only one to have all the NFL teams. NFL Street has dozens of plays and close to 15 football fields to utilize. The game mechanic that separated NFL Street from other arcade style football games was its Gamebreaker mechanic, which allowed the player to become super powerful and either almost always score a touchdown on offense, or force an interception or fumble on defense.NFL Teams/PlayersChicago Bears:WR: Marty BookerDB: Mike BrownLB: Warrick HoldmanOL: Olin KreutzDB: R.W.
